Technique: BURNED, OXIDIZED; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl with wide mouth, rounded rim, curved walls and stable base with ring-shaped foot. The paste is ochre in colour  and the surface is covered, both inside and outside, with a coating of a whitish-yellowish colour which is partially lost. The rim presents a painted red line, demarcated in the lower part by an incised line. On the body is a painted decoration with geometrical motifs: double line in red and brown encircling the piece. In two areas we find a double vertical line forming a cross with curved arms, completed by a painted diagonal cross in red.
